channel.title: My image editor [Java]
channel.description:
This week I was working on a Java image editor. All for learning purposes (And yeah I learnt soo much from this :D). And I fellt like releasing it. So here it is!
[size=18pt]Download:[/size] (It's open source) http://www.mediafire.com/?u7psdk957dw2fsp
[size=18pt]Features:[/size] Selecting. Cropping. Pixel drawing. Brush size changing. Different colors. Color copying. Saving, Opening, New file. (Duh :D)
[size=18pt]Controls:[/size] [code] Ctrl+O - Open file. Ctrl+N - New file. Ctrl+S - Save file. Ctrl+R - Custom RGB Color. Drag your mouse to draw pixels. Click with scroll button, set the underlaying color as your main color. [/code]
[size=18pt]Images:[/size] [img]http://img695.imageshack.us/img695/6495/pic1yo.png[/img] [img]http://img841.imageshack.us/img841/8373/pic2br.png[/img]
[b]Credits:[/b] Me. Some tutorials on the interwebz. The Java API.
Have fun! :P

item.title: My image editor [Java]
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

[quote=“whackatre, post:10, topic:419241”]Very nicely done, how about a zoom feature?

When coding swing, would a better approach be to memorize all functions, or to use an IDE?

I’ll take a look at the source tomorrow, it’s 2 AM haha.[/quote]
There’s no zoom function (yet). :P. And I suggest you use an IDE yes.

Read full topic

item.title: My image editor [Java]
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

Pure Slay:

Haven’t looked at the source code, but surprisingly decent for most things that I see posted here. Good job.

I used Canvas (java.awt.Canvas) to draw the Pictures on, maybe a swing Class was better? Anyways, thank you all!

item.title: My image editor [Java]
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

This week I was working on a Java image editor. All for learning purposes (And yeah I learnt soo much from this :D). And I fellt like releasing it. So here it is!

[size=18pt]Download:[/size] (It’s open source)
http://www.mediafire.com/?u7psdk957dw2fsp

[size=18pt]Features:[/size]
Selecting.
Cropping.
Pixel drawing.
Brush size changing.
Different colors.
Color copying.
Saving, Opening, New file. (Duh :D)

[size=18pt]Controls:[/size]

  Ctrl+O - Open file.
  Ctrl+N - New file.
  Ctrl+S - Save file.
  Ctrl+R - Custom RGB Color.
  Drag your mouse to draw pixels.
  Click with scroll button, set the underlaying color as your main color.

[size=18pt]Images:[/size]

Credits:
